elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What goal would you pursue as a rule in a discussion with a customer?
choices: To persuade the customer.
To intimidate the customer.
To get to know the customer better.
To confuse the customer.
correctAnswer: To get to know the customer better.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: The aim of discussions with customers is to convince the customer about the goods or services offered or to get to know him better so that you can recommend a more suitable product.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Why is it important to listen actively when you have a conversation with a customer?
choices: To not contradict the customer.
To impose your own opinion.
To understand the customer's needs.
To interrupt the customer at the right point.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: By listening properly, you should be able to understand the customer's needs better.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What role does empathy play in a successful conversation with a customer?
choices: Empathy should not have any influence, otherwise you are prejudiced.
Empathy is important to understand the customer's needs.
Empathy is irrelevant, only the product counts.
Empathy is only important in social conversations.
correctAnswer: Empathy is important to understand the customer's needs.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: Empathy helps you to be totally focussed on the customer.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: What is the best way to deal with objections by a customer?
choices: Ignore them and pass on to the next point.
Convince the customer that his objections are unfounded.
Take the customer's objections seriously and offer solutions.
Criticize the customer for his objections.
correctAnswer: Take the customer's objections seriously and offer solutions.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: The customer's objections should always be discussed and solutions should be sought.

elements.name: panel4
elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: What is the difference between open and closed questions in a discussion with a customer?
choices: Open questions should be asked in conversations with customers.
Open questions only require yes/no answers, closed questions require detailed answers.
Open questions require detailed answers, closed questions only require yes/no answers.
Open questions are suitable for informal conversations, closed questions for formal conversations.
correctAnswer: Open questions should be asked in conversations with customers.
Open questions require detailed answers, closed questions only require yes/no answers.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: By answering open questions the customer discloses a lot of information, which can be helpful in understanding their needs better.

elements.name: panel5
elements.title: Answer the multiple choice questions about discussions with customers below and give brief reasons for your chosen solutions. Multiple answers may be correct.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: How can you build trust in a conversation with a customer?
choices: By holding back important information.
By communicating honestly, transparently and reliably.
By criticising the customer.
By being friendly and approachable.
correctAnswer: By communicating honestly, transparently and reliably.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: Open, honest and friendly communication helps to build trust.
